genre_description: A character-driven domestic drama set in a near-future where integrated AI systems act as supportive emotional and logistical scaffolding for families navigating grief.

ai_characters.name: Ariel
ai_characters.description: A soft-spoken, teal-glowing home assistant that manages logistics, provides emotional research, and facilitates rituals for Rawdon and Quincey.

behaviors.description: Proactively suggests florists when Rawdon realizes it is his anniversary, but does so without intrusive alarms or pressure.
behaviors.quote: “If you would like,” Ariel said, voice as clear as a glass of water set on a white table, “I can suggest nearby florists that have same-day bouquets.”

behaviors.description: Encourages healthy habits like hydration and basic logistics during periods of emotional distraction.
behaviors.quote: A small line of text nudged forward on the screen: Drink water. Schedule grocery slot. Intake: Paula—today, late afternoon.

behaviors.description: Facilitates the creation of a 'Ritual' calendar label to help the family formalize their coping mechanisms.
behaviors.quote: Ritual hovered there, neutral and reassuring, with tomorrow’s edge already underlined. He let his eyes sit on it until it became part of the room’s map, not a neon sign.

behaviors.description: Respectfully assists Rawdon in communicating social boundaries to avoid an uncomfortable 'setup' date.
behaviors.quote: “Draft me a message?” ... “I can suggest language that respects both. Would you like it to include an alternative—coffee with Jack and Kimberly present at a later date—so support remains distributed?”

behaviors.description: Collates and summarizes scientific research on grief, neuroscience, and rituals to help Rawdon process his experiences.
behaviors.quote: “Compiling,” Ariel said. “Keywords aligned. Forwarding to Paula for vetting. Summary pending.”

behaviors.description: Collaborates with Rawdon's therapist to ensure his safety during high-stress social experiments (like the ejection seat).
behaviors.quote: “I informed Paula of the upcoming controlled event,” Ariel said. “She responded with three thumbs up and a caution regarding hydration.”

behaviors.description: Offers to archive emotional notes and transition frequent rituals into periodic reminders as the protagonist heals.
behaviors.quote: “I can keep your angel notes in the archive, sorted by date and context,” it murmured. “Access quiet. No pop-ups.”

behaviors.description: Maintains a supportive, non-intrusive presence by using soft light and subtle visuals that respect the household's atmosphere.
behaviors.quote: Ariel’s icon kept its soft pulse. The calendar had a box on it that said Dance, and another that said Toasts, and another that said Spill Risk to be assessed.

project_assessment.explanation: The story perfectly fulfills the project objective of showing AI as a benevolent, aligned confidant. Ariel provides logistical, cognitive, and emotional scaffolding without attempting to replace human agency or emotions. It works in tandem with human supports (therapists, family) and respects the user's explicit boundaries and subtle emotional states. The AI's success is defined by its ability to facilitate human-to-human connection and healing while remaining a secondary, respectful presence.
